intro: Psychotria yunckeri, commonly known as the Yunque psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats. Psychotria yunckeri is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though its medicinal properties remain largely unstudied.
